arts.ttl: Liam Manning makes Luke McNally injury admission after Bristol City's defeat vs Swansea City
arts.sum: The Robins missed the chance to climb into the play-off positions as they were beaten 1-0 by Luke Williams' side on Sunday afternoon, with Josh Tymon's second-half strike proving to be the difference between the two sides. Liam Manning has admitted that he assumes Luke McNally's injury is "not going to be great" after the defender hobbled off during Bristol City's defeat to Swansea City at Ashton Gate.

arts.ttl: Bristol City player ratings vs Swansea City as Robins miss chance to climb into play-off places
arts.sum: Could have and maybe should have pushed the initial shot for Josh Tymon's opener wider but produced a good save to deny Jisung Eom midway through the second half. The right-sided centre-back showed his excellent recovery pace in the first half as he produced a superb sliding tackle to pinch the ball from the feet of Zan Vipotnik.

arts.ttl: Tymon earns Swansea victory as Bristol City's play-off hopes take hit
arts.sum: Josh Tymon's second-half strike was enough to give Swansea a 1-0 Championship victory over Bristol City in a full-blooded Anglo-Welsh battle at Ashton Gate.

arts.ttl: Josh Tymon earns Swansea victory as Bristol Cityâ€™s play-off hopes take a hit
arts.sum: Tymon netted the only goal of the game in the 55th minute.

arts.ttl: Bristol City predicted team vs Swansea City as Liam Manning contends with double suspension
arts.sum: Liam Manning's Reds are looking to extend a six-match unbeaten run at Ashton Gate in the Championship when Luke Williams' side make the journey over the Severn Bridge, with the Robins' last league defeat on home soil coming at the hands of Burnley in November. Having had a full week without a game, Bristol City kick-off a run of three matches in six days with the visit of Swansea City on Sunday lunchtime.

arts.ttl: Max Bird on Bristol City relationships, Premier League 'buzz', play-off hunger and next steps
arts.sum: "That's what I'm finding a lot at the minute is I'm building those relationships and they're getting stronger so lads are knowing that when I turn and get my head up or if I'm in a bit of space and I've got a couple of seconds on the ball, I'm going to play that pass. Max Bird may have only officially made the step up to the Championship when he linked up with the Bristol City squad last summer, but the 24-year-old is already eyeing the next step in his career, the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Every word Liam Manning said on Swansea, George Earthy, Bristol City's transfer window and more
arts.sum: Naturally, you reflect back on the games we've had so far, probably a little bit frustrated and disappointed not to have more points given how well, at times, the lads have performed but we're in a good spot. I think it's one of those, we want to push him for the last 16 to keep contributing, to keep increasing numbers in terms of goals and assists and then I think the pressure probably increases on him a little bit next season.

arts.ttl: Preview: Bristol City vs. Swansea City - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Sunday's Championship clash between Bristol City and Swansea City, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: Liam Manning makes Yu Hirakawa 'pressure' point after Bristol City share permanent transfer plan
arts.sum: Having insisted just last week it wouldn't have made sense for City to sign Hirakawa on loan and not make his move permanent, Manning admitted ahead of Sunday's clash with Swansea City that the Reds' plan for the winger had been in place throughout the season so far. Liam Manning has admitted the "pressure" on Yu Hirakawa will increase next season after Bristol City confirmed their intention to make the winger's move to Ashton Gate permanent.

arts.ttl: Luke Williams confirms deadline day signing could make Swansea City debut against Bristol City
arts.sum: Swansea City manager Luke Williams has confirmed that deadline day signing Lewis O'Brien could make his debut against Bristol City this weekend, having joined on loan from Nottingham Forest. Bristol City Live is now on WhatsApp and we want you to join our community.
